taxon_name.authority: de Candolle in A. P. de Candolle and A. L. P. P. de Candolle

taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family asteraceae;tribe astereae;genus aphanostephus;species skirrhobasis;variety thalassius

bio:treatment.description: Plants 5–40 cm. Stems erect to decumbent, densely puberulent-hispidulous, hairs spreading to deflexed, 0.1–0.5 mm. Leaves thickened, densely, almost felty gray-hairy. Ray florets (10–)22–44. Pappi coroniform, uneven, often of awn-tipped or ciliate scales, 0.1–0.3 mm. 2n = 6.
Sand dunes near beaches, coastal sands, Rio Grande plains;
bio:treatment.discussion: Variety thalassius is found on the Gulf coast; it differs from var. skirrhobasis primarily in vestiture.
